headline: Garlic Quinoa
description: This is a quick and easy, basic quinoa side dish recipe requiring only quinoa, chicken stock, garlic, and butter.
name: Garlic Quinoa

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir garlic in melted butter until just browned, about 5 minutes.
Pour chicken broth into the saucepan; add quinoa and stir. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Remove saucepan from heat and rest mixture 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.

review.reviewBody: Great basic recipe! This was my first attempt at making Quinoa. Had to try because of the garlic. Then, I did add onion with the garlic. As it was cooking, I thought it would be great with Romano cheese (that's what I had on hand). So after cooking, I added the cheese with some parsley (for color). My husband and I LOVED it! Thank you so much for the recipe. I am now not afraid to make quinoa. This happens to be something I can eat on my low "meat protein" diet.
So easy and delicious! My hubby loves garlic and actually wants me to add more next time. The kids thought it was perfect! Thank you for sharing a great recipe!
Very good. I didn’t have chicken broth so I replaced it with a cup of Campbell onion soup and a cup of water. It came out very tasty!
Had bulk quinoa and forgot how to cook it. This recipe was perfect.

I made this and enjoyed that it was fairly simple to make! From past experience when cooking with just a chicken broth base I know the flavor tends to be on the lighter side so I added a chicken bouillon cube and an additional 1/3 C of water so I could get more flavor into the quinoa. Next time I will add more garlic to get a stronger garlic flavor.
Something I might add for anyone who is new to cooking with quinoa is if the packaging doesn't mention that it has been pre-rinsed then you may want to consider rinsing before cooking.
Nice quinoa recipe. I sautéed onion and zucchini with the garlic.
Followed all listed ingredients and directions. I used tricolor quinoa. Came out delicious. Will make again.

I’ve made this at least twice and it’s too much broth. The ratio is off. I end up with soggy quinoa. Maybe it’s because I’m at 6700 ft. elevation but I’m going to have to cut it down to 1 1/2 cups. It’s a great start to quinoa though. You can put in chopped roasted red peppers and/or sun-dried tomatoes for extra flavor and cohesion with your main dish. You can add feta or Parmesan too.
I know this is dumb but I’d never made quinoa until I used your recipe. It turned out awesome. I added salt at the end when fluffing it and it was great!
Replaced this for rice as a side dish. Enjoyed the change with this flavorful quinoa. I used chicken bone broth for added protein. Will make again.

I used homemade chicken broth, this was fantastic! It even got complements from people who didn’t know I made it at a shared meal. I may have used a little extra garlic and butter because I didn’t measure.
Very yummy!

No changes here. This is my third attempt at quinoa. This is very bland. In fact, maybe a little short of bland. It appears that my wife and I have no interest in quinoa. Nothing seems to make it interesting. To this recipe (serving), I added one tablespoon of 
butter and a pinch of additional salt. That allowed me to eat most of one serving. We threw the rest out and will not make it again. Sorry. It probably isn't you; it's the quinoa.
I subbed in olive oil, instead of butter. I did thus because I have high cholesterol. Tasted wonderful. Zucchini in under rated.
Very good. Quick and easy Side dish
I followed the recipe 100% and it turned out great!
My favourite way to cook quinoa when we are having it as a side.
I wanted to make this as a substitution for rice! Loved it! Only thing was I used low sodium chicken broth and realized that if I use it I need to add some kind of salty element. Otherwise delicious!

This was my first attempt at quinoa...it was so yummy! I had about a quarter cup of diced onions from a different recipe and so I sauteed that with the garlic. I used vegetarian, better than chicken base instead of broth. The quinoa came out delicious all by itself but once completed I tossed in a big handful of baby spinach, a handful of sliced grape tomatoes, half a cup of chick peas, and a quarter cup of crisp corn. I tossed that together and put the lid back on for less than 5 minutes so the spinach wilted then put a crumble of goat cheese on each serving with a drizzle of olive oil. So filling and SO delicious! Quinoa will now be in my regular food rotation.
It’s the only way I’ll eat quinoa
Needs some help. I wasn't a fan. I added onion as suggested by another reviewer and threw in carrots I had cooked in chicken broth. But it was still kind of bland.
Wonderful recipe great flavor. Had to cook it quite about longer than expected but was great

This was better than the boxed quinoa that I've had previously. I did think that it could use a little more flavor and next time will add some different seasoning. A great base recipe for people who don't know how to make quinoa!
I added 1 tsp of salt and substituted vegetable broth instead to make a Vegan version. It was absolutely delicious!

I made this according to the recipe and I like it a lot but it seemed to be missing something. I added a little low-sodium soy sauce. Next time I think I'll use vegetable broth and sauté some onion with the garlic. It was super quick and easy!
Really good! I added some fresh thyme while sautéing the garlic. I also added some more butter, salt and pepper before serving! Good stuff!

My whole family loved this side dish. We had it with salmon and asparagus. I made it somewhat like risotto. Like some other reviewers, I used a spoonful of minced garlic from a jar, and added chopped onion. After 20 mins of simmering, I added a few handfuls of fresh baby spinach and 3-4 tablespoons of shredded Parmesan, then tossed it all together until the spinach softened and the cheese melted.
Simple but tasty.
I have eaten quinoa in dishes before, but I have never enjoyed it alone...until this recipe. This made quinoa so much more pleasant for me. Great recipe!
Delicious!

I made this just following the recipe. Tasty side dish that could easily be modified by addition of various spices blends to provide any ethnic twist. Recipe so simple to follow, my 11 year old granddaughter was in charge of cooking the dish while her mother & I managed the remaining meal.

An all time favorite since I discovered it earlier in the year. Quick 'go to' side dish that doesn't cease to disappoint! Great for after work. My chicken broth isn't salty enough on its own, so I add a dash of salt. Can always add extra garlic, as the garlic taste is subtle to me when made according to the recipe.
I didn't care for this recipe.
How easy can it get? I just added vegetable broth and some extra garlic. With five minutes to go, I added some diced sugar snap peas from the farmer's market to add a veggie crunch.
The whole family liked it! The Grandmas even wanted the recipe.

I have made quinoa before and had disastrous results, but this recipe was amazing! The only change I made was about a quarter of an onion finely diced and cooked with the garlic. My husband loved it! (Just a suggestion, but try making it with Gorgonzola balsamic portobello mushrooms as the main course! They are delicious together!)
Simple and tasty. A nice change from rice. Will make frequently. Family loved it.
Added some diced red onions and tomatoes with the garlic. Delicious, all my guests liked it too and asked for the recipe.
Simple and delicious! Wonderful healthy side dish.
Tastes delicious. I substituted some smart balance butter alternative for the butter. Thanks for posting this recipe.
I cut the recipe in 1/2 for the 2 of us. I sauteed ch. onion and garlic in EVOO not butter. I added peas and grape tomatoes towards the end.

Made exactly as written, using red quinoa. I've been trying to introduce more whole grains, and this seemed like a basic way to prepare quinoa without getting terribly adventurous--which we are not! Hubby thought it was a little bland, but the kids and I liked it a lot. A very nice flavor to accompany any number of entrees. Could easily be jazzed up with some greens or veggies. I think next time I will use beef broth instead of chicken, just to see how it changes the flavor.
I am sure if we liked Quinoa we would like this..did not!
Great side dish, filler or last minute extra. :)
So easy & simple. I added kale & a green bean, zucchini & carrot mixture. So good & simple to make
I made this as written, and it wasn't bad, but we weren't blown away. We didn't find it to be very memorable.
I made it as written, and felt it was kind of bitter with just the garlic. My whole family prefers just plain quinoa with butter.
Good and simple to make. Thanks!
So easy and delicious! My hubby loves garlic and actually wants me to add more next time. The kids thought it was perfect! Thank you for sharing a great recipe!!
Delish! I thought this was too simple and not enough garlic to be flavourful but it is so yummy.

Generally, everyone enjoyed in my family. The biggest advantage is that it takes hardly any time to put it together. I added onion. It was quite salty so definitely would use low-sodium broth next time.
Great and simple way to make such a healthy food. Also a great base recipe for adding additional ingredients and spices to really bring your quinoa to life.
So easy and delicious. My husband even gave it thumbs up.
This is a easy to make quinoa recipe and is perfect for the first time you try it. I made the recipe as written and it turned out perfectly. You can also adjust the garlic to your liking.
Instead of butter, I use olive oil to saute the garlic. Also added some diced onion and saute with the garlic.
Full of flavor and totally awesome!! Had it with baked shrimp. Definitely a keeper!

This is my second time trying quinoa. First time was awful, but I decided to give it another shot with this recipe, definitely the right choice. My husband and I couldn't get enough of this! Can't wait to have it again! I do agree with another reviewer that it took an extra 5 minutes to cook.
Loved the garlic taste. If you are not a garlic person, may want to use a little less.
This was exceptional, and I don't usually eat quinoa. Made it exactly as written.

I made quinoa for the first time and I love garlic so I used this recipe. I also added a little chopped onion, yellow squash and a can of drained chunk chicken for protein. I was on my lunch break when I cooked it! Super easy and delicious.
Quinoa is part of my diet & as a chef it is a good sub for rice.
Delicious! I opted to roast a whole head of garlic and just add it to the quinoa/ chicken broth mixture instead of sauteing the garlic. The whole family loved it!

I thought this was just a little heavy in the chicken broth so next time I will reduce the amount. It reminded me of the pre-packaged rice mixes and I never use the entire spice pack with them because I feel like that is all you taste. Other than that this was a good, quick side dish.
I followed the recipe, except I added halved cherry tomatoes. It was fantastic!!!
This was my first time making quinoa for my family and they loved it. This will definitely become a staple side dish in our house.
Delicious. Just the right amount of garlic flavor. Brown color okay. I would pair it with colorful vegetables, like greens and reds.

Made this for lunch, but cut it back to 2 servings. My first time having quinoa, i used lactose free margarine and my own chicken broth. I added peas for color. I Really liked it, my husband not so much. Guess it's not for everyone. Even though i found it took 5 minutes more to cook i gave it 5 stars cause its easy and tasty. Thank you for this recipe, i will be making it again.

We absolutely loved this recipe. My husband does not like to try new things, but when I saw this recipe had garlic, I thought maybe there was a chance he'd try it. He took three helpings!! I used minced garlic from a jar, and it was VERY garlicy (just the way I like it) but I can see that it may be too much for garlic "likers", not "lovers". I used the mixed Quinoa which gave it some added colour.
